name: Hamburger and Macaroni Hot Dish
author: Kristi Goulette Lozensky
summary: Hot dish or goulash, call it what you want. I grew up on this quick and easy meal. I have tweaked the ingredients a bit, but the results are just as good. Serve with a side salad for a great weekday dinner. Enjoy.
ingredients: 1 pinch Italian seasoning, or to taste
1 pinch seasoned salt, or to taste
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook elbow macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until cooked through but firm to the bite, 8 minutes; drain
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook and stir ground beef and minced onion in the hot skillet until almost browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes
Add garlic to ground beef mixture and cook until beef is browned, 2 to 3 more minutes; drain and discard excess grease
Stir macaroni, tomato soup, corn, Italian seasoning, and seasoned salt into ground beef mixture; top with American cheese slices
Cover skillet until cheese is melted, 2 to 3 minutes; stir well
